```java
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.InputStream;
import java.net.ServerSocket;
import java.net.Socket;

public class Server {
    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
        ServerSocket serverSocket = new ServerSocket(3333);
        Socket socket = serverSocket.accept();
        InputStream inputStream = socket.getInputStream();
        byte[] bytes = new byte[1024];
        while (true) {
            try {
                inputStream.read(bytes);
            } catch (IOException e) {
                e.printStackTrace();
                break;
            }
        }
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: 
In this code, we are creating a server socket that listens on port 3333. When a client connects, we get the input stream from the socket. We then enter an infinite loop where we try to read from the input stream. If the client disconnects abruptly, the read operation will throw an IOException, which we catch and print. This will simulate the "java.net.SocketException: Connection reset" exception.
